algorithm: The new algorithm computes the scores for each bin based on the logarithm of the sum of the rest capacities of all the bins, the reciprocal of the absolute difference between the rest capacity of each bin and the item size, and the square of the difference between the rest capacity of each bin and the average capacity of all bins. The scores are then modified by a function that emphasizes the assignment of items to bins with higher modified scores, and the modified scores are adjusted by a function that penalizes bins with high rest capacities. Finally, the scores are normalized by dividing them by the sum of the modified scores plus the total number of bins.
code:
import numpy as np

def score(item: int, bins: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    sum_rest_capacities = np.log(np.sum(bins))  # Logarithm of the sum of the rest capacities of each bin
    reciprocal_diff = 1 / np.abs(bins - item)  # Reciprocal of the absolute difference between the rest capacity of each bin and the item size
    square_diff = np.square(bins - np.mean(bins))  # Square of the difference between the rest capacity of each bin and the average capacity of all bins
    modified_scores = np.maximum(sum_rest_capacities, reciprocal_diff, square_diff)  # Modify scores by taking the maximum value among the logarithm, reciprocal, and squared values
    modified_scores = np.power(modified_scores, 0.5)  # Adjust scores by taking the square root to emphasize assignment of items to bins with higher scores
    adjusted_scores = modified_scores / (1 + np.exp(bins - np.mean(bins)))  # Further adjust scores by penalizing bins with high rest capacities
    sum_modified_scores = np.sum(adjusted_scores)  # Sum of the modified scores
    scores = adjusted_scores / (sum_modified_scores + len(bins))  # Normalize scores by dividing by the sum of modified scores plus the number of bins
    return scores
